content:
Also, child-proofing the internet and the politics of Ramadan television

PRESIDENT DONALD Trump kicks off his state visit to Britain with some opening shots at London's mayor Sadiq Khan. But larger issues will take centre stage. Amid Brexit, a leadership contest and simmering security tensions, we discuss the strains on the “special relationship”. We consider how regulators and tech giants can tackle the wilds of the internet to make browsing safe for children . And, a Ramadan drama in Saudi Arabia  reveals how the crown prince wants his kingdom to be perceived. Runtime: 22 min

Listen on: Apple Podcasts  |  Spotify  |  Google  |  Stitcher  |  TuneIn

ex: n. 〔机〕缝针；拼逢机；钉箱机；齿形压滚
网络 带材缝合机；钉书机；订书机
n. 特丽萨（女子名）
n. 皇冠；王冠；王位；桂冠
v. 为…加冕；形成…顶部；给…加顶；（尤指通过增添成就、成功等）使圆满
网络 冠部；花冠；牙冠
eg2: land owned by the Crown
王国的土地
a Minister of the Crown
王国的大臣
Who's appearing for the Crown(= bringing a criminal charge against sb on behalf of the state) in this case?
谁将在此案中代表王国政府出庭？
She refused the crown(= refused to become queen) .
她拒绝接受王位。
his claim to the French crown
他声称有继任法国王位的权利
She is determined to retain her Wimbledon crown.
她决心卫冕她的温布尔登网球赛的冠军宝座。
the crown of a hill
山顶
Czech crowns
捷克克朗
Queen Elizabeth was crowned in 1953.
伊丽莎白女王于 1953 年加冕。
The prince was soon to be crowned King of England.
王子不久就要被立为英格兰国王了。
His head was crowned with a mop of brown curls.
他长了一头蓬乱的棕色鬈发。
The award of the Nobel Prize has crowned a glorious career in physics.
荣获诺贝尔奖使其物理学研究的辉煌事业达到了顶点。
Their efforts were finally crowned with success.
他们的努力终于取得圆满成功。
I've had one of my teeth crowned.
我的一颗牙齿镶了假齿冠。
It was cold and raining, and, to crown it all, we had to walk home.
天气寒冷又下着雨，最糟的是我们得走着回家。
It was cold and raining, and, to crown it all, we had to walk home.
天气寒冷又下着雨，最糟的是我们得走着回家。

ex: vt. 察觉，感觉；理解；认知
vi. 感到，感知；认识到
eg2: The concept reality means to each of us what we , what we experience.
真实的概念对我们每个人都意味着我们感知的一切，经历的一切。
How we perceive them depends on our relationship with those who carry them out.
我们如何理解这些法令依赖于我们与那些执行者的关系。
Regardless of your intentions, your reputation is how others perceive you, whether it is realistic or not.
不管你的意图如何，名声真实与否，你的名声关系到别人对你的感觉如何。

ex: n. 监管机构；（速度、温度、压力的）自动调节器
网络 调整器；稳压器；呼吸调节器
vt. 显示；透露；揭露；泄露
n. 揭露；暴露；门侧，窗侧
vi. 炖；内心充满；即将爆发
vt. 炖
n. 炖；即将沸腾的状态；即将发作
n. (Simmer)人名；(德、捷)西默尔；(法)西梅

wp.simmer down: 被煮浓;冷静;冷静下来;沉着

eg2: Instead of a gentle , we boil our stews and braises until they are tough and dry.
炖菜或肉的时候，我们也没有及时将菜出锅，而是会一直炖到肉变的又干又硬才罢休。
Bring to the boiling point, add the previously cooked carrot and barley, Worcestershire, ketchup, and salt and pepper to taste, then  for ten minutes longer.
等水煮沸后，加入先前煮好的胡萝卜块和大麦、伍斯特沙司、番茄酱、适量的盐和胡椒粉，然后炖煮十多分钟左右即可。
Reduce the heat to medium-low, cover the pot, and  the meatballs for 2 hours, adding some water if necessary to keep the mixture from sticking to the bottom of the pot.
将肉丸添加到煮沸的白菜汤中，减弱火势至中低档，盖上锅盖，再慢煮的肉丸汤2小时，如果需要，可添加水，以保证汤料混合物不沾锅底。

wp.longitudinal strain: 纵向应变;纵向变形;线应变;长轴应变
wp.volumetric strain: 体积应变;体应变;		容积应变
wp.breaking strain: 断裂应变;致断应变;破坏应变;裂断应变
wp.dynamic strain: 动应变;动态应变;动态应变放大器;动态张力
wp.creep strain: 蠕动应变;蠕变变形;蠕变应变;潜应变

ex: n. 张力；拉紧；负担；扭伤；血缘
vi. 拉紧；尽力
vt. 拉紧；滥用；滤去；竭力
n. (Strain)人名；(英)斯特兰
n. （植物、动物的）品种；种类
eg2: Whatever might have caused some muscle , it could be the source of your back pain.
不管怎样都有可能导致某些肌肉的紧张，它可能是背痛的原因。
If you go on living, you do so only through your capacity for objectification, your ability to free yourself, in writing, from the infinite .
如果你还要继续活下去，你只有通过自身客体化的能力，你能用写作从无限的拉力中解放你自己。
And so it began to pile up until one day I collapsed from the strain of it, becoming an empty shell, a parody of who I used to be.
所以它开始慢慢地堆积起来，知道有一天我在那些压力中崩溃了，变成一个空壳，变成过去的一拙劣的模仿品。

ex: v. 处理；阻截；与某人交涉；向某人提起（问题或困难情况）
n. 用具；阻截；阻截铲球；阻截队员
网络 解决；滑车；对付
eg2: The government is determined to tackle inflation.
政府决心解决通货膨胀问题。
I tackled him about the money he owed me.
我就他欠我钱的事与他进行了交涉。
He was tackled just outside the penalty area.
他就在禁区外让对方把球抢断。
He tackled a masked intruder at his home.
他在家里抓住了一个私自闯入的蒙面人。

Title: “She's going to stick to her guns on Huawei. She's got nothing to lose”—Theresa May and Donald Trump meet
